reviews.content: I was reminded of this film when there was a reference to it in a recent episode of Family Guy. I thought I would put my fond memories of the film to the test (a dangerous thing to do usually) and go out and hire it. I was pleasantly surprised to find that this film manages to be entertaining two decades later.For those of you that haven't seen it, I'm not sure if I can promise a great movie experience, because I know much of my enjoyment of this film is connected to fond memories of my original (multiple) viewings way back when. But I would like to think that it is still a decent film for kids and young teens, and it goes without saying that for those of you reading this who are thinking about watching it again after many years distant from the last time, I highly recommend a revisiting of this film.This film is a fairly straightforward adventure movie, but very well done, and the feeling of empathy one has for the main characters is the thing that carries the viewer to the end. Twenty years is long enough for subtle but meaningful shifts in the cultural values of a society, and I did cringe slightly at times, but that is to be expected and not an indictment on the film.

From the start of the opening credits of Ma and her two sons fleeing through Astoria at high speeds whilst introducing us to a small band of kids who we lovingly came to know as the Goonies, to a pirate ship sailing into the distance which puts POTC to shame with it's authentic grace 'The Goonies' is one of those movies which aimed to please and did so much more.It's the grand adventure which every child young and old wishes they could have lived and nigh on twenty years later still impresses. The eighties produced some memorable movies in it's decade and 'The Goonies' along with others stands the test of time. With the small band of heroes Mikey, Mouth, Chunk and Data with the addition of some older but non the wiser teenagers of Brand, Andi and Steph we are taken on the grandest adventure with the simplest of terms. A treasure hunt. Every trick in the book is thrown in, A car chase, a treasure map with cryptic clues, dubloons, pirates, underground caves, dead guys, bad guys, pirate ships and skeletons. And of course Sloth.It's the stuff fairy tales couldn't get enough of and yet it was so real you almost wished yourself to Astoria to live the grand adventure itself. You can't help but laugh at each small intricate detail to the sarcasm of Mouth and how to 'pack the drugs' to poor Chunk relaying his life story to save his poor fingers from the blender. Throw in Mikey to touch the soft spot in your heart and raise a tear, and Data who has a gadget to get you out of every situation. Andi and Brand provide the romance, although in saying Mikey gets a look in too and Steph tries and fails to provide the adult expertise before reverting to perfect sarcasm battles with Mouth. And all this whilst being chased by the Fratelli's.All in all, praise upon praise cannot say how good 'The Goonies' is, I was five when it was released, and it's been a favourite from then, although I do remember being scared of Sloth at the time. I killed off the version I watched and re-watched and re-watched recorded onto video from all those years ago, bought it on VHS and killed that version too, Thankfully DVD's are that little bit more hard wearing. I hope to be watching it in another twenty years time and still loving it.

i love this film i loved it when i first watched it and whenever i watch it again it takes me back to being a kid in the 80s what a great decade to be a kid i think everyone had there own goonie clan where they just went out exploring i know i did but our exploring didn't go as far at the films did but it was fun none the less. of course the film is dated now but can any of you tell me that you don't wish you were that age again. only one other film makes me remember the 80s fondly and thats gremlins but thats a Christmas movie goonies is for summer and another point can any of you watch that data kid without laughing even having seen the film umpteen times

reviews.review_title: A young group of kids seek treasure to save their homes.
reviews.content: Even today I still enjoy this Spielberg classic.Mikey leads the Goonies on an adventure they (and you) will never forget, when they find a treasure map in the attic.  In hopes of saving their homes from being torn down to make room for a golf course, the Goonies elude the Fratelli gang in search of One-Eyed-Willie's famous pirate treasure.  More important than finding treasure, the Goonies find how tight their friendships really are.

reviews.review_title: It was the best then and it still is today
reviews.content: I was 14 when Goonies came out in the theaters. It fast became my favorite movie, and my brother's (he was 12), too. It was on our SelecTV cable box (remember that?) repeatedly in the next year or so and we knew every line of every character. It was amazing. I literally wanted to BE Kerri Green and, of course, would have loved to have had an adventure like the Goonies had (and to have kissed Josh Brolin).We went camping this last weekend in a yurt and there was a dvd player in it. I took Goonies and watched it with my 11 year old 3 times. He loved it. Much like my older son did (who owns a "Goonies Never Say Die" t-shirt) when we watched it together when he was about 10.It's classic. It's a solid story that kids everywhere can relate to. It's magical. It takes me right back to my childhood, too, everytime I see it.Awesome movie. Amazing cast. Movie magic 80s style. I love it and always will.

reviews.review_title: A Family film for ALL the Family!
reviews.content: One of the best family films EVER made! And when I say family, I mean ALL the family. Too often 'Family film' means a film for kids - not this. This is up there (and in some respects exceeds) the likes of Back to the Future, Karate Kid (original), Ghostbusters *and newer* Finding Nemo, Monsters Inc.This is one of my all time favourites I've introduced to my 10 year old daughter who is getting fed up with the poor quality of films coming out. She loved it, and I loved watching it with her. So few 'family films' nowadays hold anything for me, watching films with my daughter was nearing a chore. (a shame, because I LOVE movies). From the characters, all well created, unique, and instantly likable (mostly), to a well thought out, yet simple plot this film entertains everybody from Grandad down to young children. (about 8ish)And who can watch Goonies without a "Hey youuooo guys!!...?Squinty
This movie is a classic, I may watch it and love it out of nostalgia but I think it stands the test of time and has everything you want in a family film.

reviews.review_title: The greatest kid adventure of all time
reviews.content: This movie is my favorite of all time! No other movie better captures the adolescents' adventure taste than this movie! Long Live the Goonies!

this is one those movies i can watch over and over again... have lost count of the number of times I've seen it in total.a local gang of kids calling themselves the goonies stumble across a treasure map and go on one last adventure together, encountering booby traps, a vicious mafia family, and a lovable deformed mutant.just brilliant fun all the way through. classic Spielberg the way he used to make movies. pure escapism from start to finish. likable characters, entertaining story.. well what more can i say about this film.pix
Watched this for the first time in the 90s and now here we are years later and this is still one of my favorites!

This movie is the meaning of the word nostalgia; especially for those of us who were kids when we first saw this movie. It was like we were observers to a great adventure, starting in the dark attic of a beautiful old house in Astoria, to the cool fall weather close to the sea, to the old hideout and the almost cartoonish bad guy characters. What makes this movie a cut above any other treasure hunt movie is how Chunk's ditzy, clumsy character accidentally uncovers the start of this whole Goonies adventure. We don't have some super intelligent character figuring out every clue in the movie. It's what makes this movie much more believable / realistic. It's a lot of fun and still remembered today for a reason!

reviews.review_title: You must be this short to see this movie...
reviews.content: I was 8 when this first came out and to this day it remains one of my favorite movies, not because it's a great film but because it reminds me of something I may never have again. Sure, it has some flaws and is obviously aimed at a younger audience, but I'm 21 now and I still enjoy it when it comes on. So folks, drop your cynicism and maturity for a little while when you watch this, take yourself back to a time when adventure and simple friendships were all that was necessary, and enjoy a fun movie.

I see this movie, and it always reminds me of my childhood.  This movie is exactly how I was in my adolescence.  I ran around, pretending to look for treasure and such.  However, these kids have one slight difference from me, they really looked for treasure.  This movie plays off of stereotypes for kids, the cripple, the brain, the mouth, the clutz, etc. and binds them together in a realistic manner.  Plus, it's a good old fashioned adventure. Another added plus is I work with the mentally impaired a lot.  John Matuszac's portrayal of Sloth is very realistic, and I think he should have gotten on Oscar for his portrayal.  And, just so everyone knows, I have a friend who acts and looks like chunk.  Overall, it was an excellent movie, and I would watch it constantly.

reviews.review_title: This is one of my all-time favorite movies from my childhood.
reviews.content: Wow! I can't even tell you how many times I've seen this movie. I could sit and tell you each line and what is going to happen next. This movie is a classic from the 80s and a good memory from my childhood. "This is our time" and "Hey, you guys!" are favorite lines. The Goonies is a good conversationalist piece because people remember it and love it. It has a good story and not bad acting. Sean Astin is a cutie in this movie. We all know that we had friends that we did crazy things with when we were kids. This movie just lets us remember them (well not looking for treasure, but something close).

reviews.review_title: aren't we all a little goonie?
reviews.content: I was about the age of the goonies when I saw this movie in theatres.  It was my favorite movie instantly!  I purchased the book (based on the movie??)and read it the week after seeing the movie.  The taste of adventure and the solving of the puzzles backed up nicely with humour made for a very enjoyable movie that still ranks in my top 5 of all time.

This is such an entertaining film. The kids (who today, are no longer kids)really held it together. Sean Astin as the pubescent, not so healthy dreamer who fills his friends with hope, and Josh Brolin as his older brother, handsome even at that age, leading their friends in the quest of their young lives...to save their homes from the <obligatory and hateful> land baron and his vapid son. But the villans, especially Robert Davi as Jake Fratelli, keep this movie moving along. Mama Fratelli (Anne Ramsey), evil and partial to her son, Francis (Joe Pantoliano)growls and sputters delightfully. Robert Davi, however, crooning Italian opera, made the biggest impression on me. This movie made me a big fan. His delivery, presence and comic badness coupled with that incredible singing voice and unforgetable face keeps me looking for his name in newly released films. Goonies was a wonderful introduction to Mr. Davi and, since Profiler is in reruns, I hope to see him in more featured roles.

reviews.review_title: This is one of the greatest films of the 20th century!
reviews.content: No matter who you are, or where you live, The Goonies should always stand out in your mind as one of the greatest movies churned out of tinsel town. I am so happy that this film has not only touched me, but many people the world over. This film is probably the most important film of my childhood. I can remember many a rainy day where my Dad would take me to the local video store to hire a film and we I would always pick up the same video.....The Goonies. After 12 years things don't change. It still rains in England, and I still watch The Goonies on a regular basis. Didn't we all at one time, wish that we were a Goonie huh? I personally always wanted to be Mikey, leading the gang to "One Eyed Willy". It's that kind of interaction that is missing from films today. I just hope that the good people at Warner Brothers and Amblin Entertainment deside to release it on DVD. This film deserves to be dusted and polished digitally so that future generations of young kids can enjoy it as much as I have. Whoever you are young or old and haven't so already, I strongly suggest that you watch The Goonies. I hope it touches you as much as me. With rumors of a script going around Hollywood to do a sequel, now is an excellent time to catch the original and see why it is worth a sequal! For anyone who doesn't love this film all I can say is.....I don't understand. Everyone should love this film!

So, I am currently in my living room with my kids as they watch Goonies. They LOVE it, and why not? When I was there age it was one of my all time fav movies. So, I start to wonder what ever happened to the actress that plays Andy...come over to IMDb and look up the movie The Goonies, 1985!!!!!!!!!!!!! Are you kidding me!!!!! 23 years ago, holy crap! Now I feel like such a freaking old fart. But still it's a great movie! And nice to see that it stands the test of time. The kids are laughing and totally into it. Plus there isn't any gore or questionable moments in it so I am not sitting here thinking of how I am going to explain any parts to them.

reviews.review_title: Magic, I'm going to search the sewer and find treasure below my house!
reviews.content: What a truly inspiring film to go and get out of the house and into the wildlife and explore the surrounding area around your house. I am now 19 and the movie makes me want to call up all my old friends from grammer school and invite them to go on a treasure hunt down the local sewer and find some diamond rings somebody flushed down the toilet. The film was fantastic, it brought back so many memories of my childhood and Chunk was so familiar to me that I could have sworn that it was a take off of me. I bought this film on video and still watch it every couple of months or so. If you have a child whinging at home and go and hire out the Goonies and sit back and watch it with the kids. It is absolute magic, and a classic that will never be forgotten. See if you can pick which one is Sam Gamgee in Lord of the Rings! I wish there really was pirate ships and other buried treasure around the place, infact form tomorrow I am quitting my job and am going to come and explorer, all thanks to the Goonies. P.S. To the person who wrote the script and picked the right actors *KISS*

reviews.review_title: Brilliant! An instant family movie classic.
reviews.content: Fantastic! You won't find a better family adventure flick than The Goonies. Fun for all ages. I must have seen it about thirty five times... NO JOKE! Any viewer will instantly fall in love with the hilarious 'Chunk'. I can picture myself when I am 65 still laughing at this film and taking me back to my adventurous childhood! Take my word watch this film it's a family classic.

I was three years old when this  movie came out, so of course I didn't see it in the theater. However, growing up I've always thought "The Goonies" has been with me along the way. This movie is so good and such a classic 80's film that I can't express my feelings enough. I realize I'm making The Goonies sound like Citizen Kane, but really how many people can say that they don't remember this movie, or how much of an impact it had on you when you were little. Everything about this movie is great. Simply a wonderful movie... ROCKY ROAD!!!

This film is fantastic.  I've watched it since I was very small and I'm 19 now and it still stands the test of time.  It might be old and contain cliches and a predictable plot but that's all the fun of it.  It's not a movie you have to sit and analysis, it's a movie to sit and watch and be enjoyed because of it's simplicity.  It's a feel good film and that's exactly what it makes you do.Sean Astin and Corey Feldman steal the show but the rest of the cast hold the film together as well.  I can't think of a bad thing to say about this movie because it's just soooo good.  The story is great for kids and grown-ups and the characters are identifiable with.There's something here for everybody, watch it, it's enjoyable- no matter how many times you've seen it.

This has got to be the funniest 80's movie made! Reminds me of the cartoon Rugrats. Chunk the scaredy cat...Mikey the leader...Brandon the brat...Mouth and Data Phil and Lil...and, well... you get the picture. But it is a super funny movie! Chunk's "Soda...oh boy im thirstie...damn it!". Rent this movie its so funny!

Goonies brings a gang of teens together in a unique and special way. It illustrates how some friendships are incredibly beautiful, even in those moments when it appears a particular chapter within the friendship is coming to an end. In this case, the relocation of the families in the community. It's a film the whole family can enjoy, because the jokes span the spectrum of age. And as it is with any great film, there is a solid and gripping story at the core. It's a fun film and I've loved it for over 30 years.

This movie has a lot of good memories for me as a child growing up in the 90s. When I watched this movie the first time I was around seven or eight years old and lived with both of my parents in a small house in Plant City FL. We lived right across the street from the Strawberry Festival.If you ever watch this movie and its your first time doing so then do yourself a solid and try to reach back into your childhood, (if your an adult), and imagine your seven to twelve year old self watching this. It would make a lot more sense if you did it that way. This movie was created with love and it shows in every single scene. The adult actors in the film were superb, the children actors did an amazing job, even Mouth who grew up to be, well not so great. I love every single one of them and every single time I see this movie it brings back the great childhood memories I had living in my childhood home. It also makes me want to turn back into a kid and go treasure hunting like they did in the film. I plan on doing this with my daughter. The music was awesome and fun, the settings were really well done and the ship was a real freaking Pirate Ship.Listen this isn't really a review just something to try and get you to see this movie with your kids or if you do not have any, then with yourself not going in and expecting a modern story because its nothing like that. Its a movie to be enjoyed with the heart and soul of a child looking for adventure not for adults looking for a serious down to earth film.

reviews.review_title: The Goonies...What else is there to say?
reviews.content: This movie so defines everything that a child of the eighties wanted to be. I remember trying to find secret passages and treasure maps after watching this movie for the first time.  And who doesn't know where the classic "HEY YOU GUYS!" came from.  The Goonies will be awesome forever!I'm done.

I absolutely love this film! When i was growing up i watched it nearly every day, a bit before school and the rest after! In my opinion it is the best family / kids film ever... great story, cracking cast, wonderful wonderful film! Mouth was always my fav. goonie as i was pretty similar as a kid! The best part of the film for me is any scene with sloth! He is a true screen king! If you want to watch a film with your kids or girlfriend or if you just want to enjoy an easy well scripted well acted funny film the goonies is the answer. It's fantastic!"hey chunk i've got some naked pictures of your mum! wanna buy them?"

Sean Astin  does an impeccable job as the lead character. (Mikey) He should be recognized for this pre-Lord of the Rings movie. Highly Recommended. A must see for adventure-loving children and adults alike.

I remember watching The Goonies countless times as a child & I recently bought a DVD copy expecting that the film isn't actually as good as I remembered. How wrong I was!Basically ,& I know its a cliché, but they don't make movies like this anymore. Its a typical lads fantasy movie & I'd put it up there with Rob Reiners Stand By Me (also released in 1985) as one of the greatest 'bonding' films ever made.Surprisingly it comes from the director of the classic horror film The Omen, but not surprising is that a certain Mr Spielberg has put his stamp all over the film. The cast are all likable characters - especially the sensitive Mikey, the loud Mouth, the inventive Data, the lovable Chunk (who could forget 'The Truffle Shuffle'!), the clumsy Fratelli family (especially the brilliant Anne Ramsay - now sadly deceased) & the heroic Sloth ("Hey you guys!").Some of the actors have continued their success - Corey Feldman (Mouth) went on to the aforementioned Stand By Me & Gremlins (then sadly made less successful films), Sean Astin (Mikey) has made himself immortal in the movies as he played Samwise in Peter Jackson's awesome Lord Of The Rings trilogy, Josh Brolin (Brad) has continued to work in films & Martha Plimpton has gained critical acclaim for her theatre work.The movie has all you need for a couple of hours of pure escapism - a treasure map, an secret underground passage, booby traps, pirates and of course the good old "good vs evil".The Goonies has stood the test of time 20 years later. If you remember this film from your childhood I urge you to re-visit it - you won't be disappointed. A bone-fide movie classic!

The goonies is one of the greatest movies EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!It is hilarious,romantic and a great action movie I mean it has 7 great young adults a.k.a(the goonies)who go on an adventure while following a treasure to try to find a way so they don't have to move out of the Goon Docks. So they go in pursue of finding treasure which would be there way of not moving.On there adventure they run into a problem actually 3 the Fratellis's whom own a restaurant above where the treasure is supposedly being hid.Some of the Goonies Mouth,Stef,andy,brand,mikey,and Data found a secret passage way under the fire place and still went in pursue of the treasure while Chunk went to find the police.But chunk got a ride from the Fratellis's which didn't go to the police ,the fratellis's went to go find the other goonies while Chunk then found his new friend Sloth who ended up saving the Goonies.While not realizing it Mikey accidentally took Gems which saved there house.It was a real great adventure movie and i would recommend it to any one who wants to see a great movie !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!love #1 rtist

reviews.review_title: Only for Kids under 15 or maybe under 12
reviews.content: This is a movie with a bunch of kids who save their part of the town from being turned into a golf course. There are lot of times in the movie when you might feel 'that's silly' but it might be a nice watch for the kids. Kids might have lot of fun watching a bunch a kids trying to pull off a breath taking treasure adventure. But for an adult mind it looks too childish and at times boring. I gave this 6 considering it might be lot of fun for kids under the age group of 15 or maybe 12 but I would have personally given it only 4 or 5 out of 10.Maybe I expected a lot from this as the story was from Steven Spielberg. But the whole movie is based on some impulsive events that take place all in one day. The connectivity is loose at many instances and the humour is real immature or too juvenile. The movie starts with a small introduction of each character but is very lame. Overall it's good if the kids want to watch some adventure flick but otherwise it's a total waste of time.

"Hey you gu-uys!" Because I grew up in the 80's, I like to watch movies that remind me of my childhood- and this is certainly one of them.  It brings back memories of what it was like to be a kid- of getting into mischief and hanging out with your friends.  The characters in "The Goonies" grow on you and you see them as real, not fictional-- as they portray their parts in a way that any kid (or any adult who has even a spark of childhood nostalgia) can relate to. This movie will never grow old to me- it will remain a classic forever.

reviews.review_title: A real treat of a movie that anyone should watch.
reviews.content: I saw this film for the first time when it was in the cinemas at Portugal. I was very young and I really enjoyed it. The adventures, the cast, the plot, the ending, and all the climax were really exciting. After a few years, I stumbled onto it on my local video store, and in a day I watched it another five times. Later, I bought a copy, and since that day I watch it very often. My greatest hope is that Rich Donner will do a sequel with the same cast (much older), but still a good cast.

There was a time when boys would spend a whole day watching their favorite heroes, dreaming of riding a crusade against Darth Vader's Empire or fighting the enemies among the Knights of the Round Table. Just like in the Fantasy Island, where Mr. Roarke and Tatoo would make all one's wishes come true, The Goonies has the special talent to bring our childhood fantasies back and remind us how great those years were.In this 1985 movie, a bunch of kids find a map which indicates the spot where the evil pirate One-Eyed-Willie buried a big treasure stolen from English ships in the 1500's. As we can predict, they decide to seek for the gold and precious stones to help their parents who are about to be expelled from their homes because they can't make ends meet and also because some wealthy men want to put their houses down to build a country club on it's place. Dangers, traps and even a family of thieves - the Fratelli - are after them.As the film goes on, we can see how closer the friends get and how supportive we all should be. They would always be there for each other, no matter how deep their problems are. Even a rich girl, Andy, is accepted by the group, in a very politically correct act, where no distinctions are made. The scene in which the guys are stuck in a hole, is very touching and really digs our sense of aid.Richard Donner directed this movie and another famous director, Chris Columbus wrote the screenplay, based on a Steven Spielberg's story. Matt Sweeney was responsable for the special effects and the main theme ( They 'r good enough ) was written and performed by Cindy Lauper.After the film, none of the kids became famous actors. Corey Feldman and Kerry Green took part in some teenage comedies, while Sean Astin showed up in "Memphis Belle" and Ke Huy Quan was the young Indiana Jone's chinese taxi driver in "The Temple of the Doom". The only one who joined some serious projects was Martha Plimpton.But these are just technical details. What really counts in "The Goonies" are the two hours of humanity, pleasure, inocence, friendship - and even the first love - that only children can show in their eyes. In fact, it's a small journey to our past, to a time when your deepest worries were about the girl (or the boy) on the next chair.

"Hey you guyssss" GooniesIf you like adventure, mystery, comedy you would love this film. Goonies is based on a group of young boys named Chuck, Mickey, Mouth, Date and an older brother named Brand and two older girls named Andy and Stef searching for a lost pirate ship. The adventure the group runs into on the way to the treasure makes this movie not only comedy but also an emotional journey for the characters and the audience. Filled with puzzles, boobytraps and constant reminders of how many came before them the group works together to create a close bond through the adventure. The group realizes that after this they will all be separated and will never have an adventure like this again. They will be separated by time and distance.Before the movie came out the names alone of the director, Richard Donner, and the writers, Chris Columbus (screenplay) and Steven Spielberg (story by) already had a reputation for having good movies. Donner directed The Superman movies which were a hit. Spielberg is accredited with E.T. and Indian Jones with many other hit movies following. Chris Columbus was a screenplay writer for Gremlins which was referenced in the movie Goonies. With these three involved Goonies was destined to be a good movie.The group tested their luck hiring both a mix of seasoned and new actors to play leading roles in the movie. The new actors included Mikey (Sean Astin), Chunk (Jeff Cohen), Data (Ke Huy Quan), and Andy (Kerri Green). All of these actors had experience acting in one or less movies. The seasoned actors included Brand (Josh Brolin), Mouth (Corey Feldman), and Stef (Martha Plinpton). These actors all worked well together to make you feel like you were part of this group. The group of characters in this film have continued to make other notable films.The characters brought the overall feeling of the movie due to their high acting skills. Although some of these actors were new to acting they took on the role they were assigned well. Between the serious characters, the comedians, and the floaters the audience is able to identify with the characters and build a connection to their personalities. The director and writers made the characters consistent throughout the story which gave an understanding to the audience of what to expect from each character. From the beginning of the movie Mikey took on a serious role. This was first seen at Mikey's house when Chunk was trying to get in and Mouth would not unlock the gate until he did the Truffle Shuffle. Mikey made sure that they stopped playing around and let him in. Speilberg and Columbus showed throughout the movie that kids will be kids at even scary times. During suspenseful moments the group continues to crack jokes and still act like young boys.I would rate this movie 10 out of 10 stars! Spielberg, Columbus, and Donner have created a movie that is good for all ages. Goonies is the bomb go and watch it.

reviews.review_title: The greatest comedy film ever made!
reviews.content: Simply put, this is the greatest movie of the 80s.  No question.  What more can you ask for than a movie that has chunk do the truffle shuffle?  More quoteables than you could ever want from a movie!  "Rocky road?", "First you gotta do the truffle shuffle", "jerk alert". The DVD is highly recommended as the entire 7 goonies come back to do audio commentary and reveal cool details.  If you haven't seen this movie buy it!!!! It will soon be your favorite.  It is the funniest movie ever made.  With the best child actors ever assembled in one movie.  I've probably seen this movie 100 times and can't wait to see it 100 more.

reviews.review_title: Can I ever stop loving this film??
reviews.content: The answer just has to be no.  No matter how juvenile, silly, and down right infantile, people call the film, it is still my favourite.  Right from the day I first saw it to fifty viewings later, it still has lost none of its charm.  Every single line is memorable, and still has me reciting the film.  A true children's classic, with such brilliant characters as Sloth, Chunk, and the ingenious Data.  When I watch this film I can become Nine years old again, if only for a short while. A True True children's classic.

reviews.review_title: Forget Raging Bull, this is the Greatest movie of the 80's!
reviews.content: The goonies is the greatest kids film ever made. simple as that. It transports you to the childhood world of adventure better than any other film.

Hi you all.I chatted a while with my girlfriend about the movie The Goonies.We were both wondering what happened to John Matuszak.We are now sad, because of the death of this man.Can you imagine, we have both a very, very different background, and we both were thinking about his character in The Goonies...A mix of brutality and gentleness.A nice man in the corpse of a monster. What a concept, for us kids...I wish he had impressed a lot of kids, such as us... Just like we were.And we miss him.

This is one of the best adventure films i have ever seen. I was too young to see it when it was first released, but i have watched countless times since then, and it's one of those films you keep watching, over & over because although you know every single detail of the film, you have to go back to it. The actors were pretty good for their age, and the comedy element still creases me up. I'd recommend this film to anyone of any age. I'm glad there wasn't a sequel though, this is a one off classic.

I first saw this movie when I was real little. I think I was about 8 or 9 years old. I had been visiting my grandparents and My cousin was with me, so my grandmother took my cousin and I to the video store to rent some videos. Well I was looking through what they had when I came upon this movie. I liked the picture was on the front of the box and thought this might be cool movie. Well, I was right it a fantastic movie. reviews.review_title: The definition of a cult classic.
reviews.content: If I could bottle up my childhood into one movie it would be Goonies. This fun adventure and comedy made it cool for kids to believe in something more than themselves.

I love the Goonies because it's silly. It's a classic movie dealing with kids on an adventure to save their home from being foreclosed. The leader of the Goonies, Mikey (played by an adorable Sean Astin), finds a map of an ancient pirate's ("One-Eyed Willy") treasure. The Goonies follow the map and wind up in caves deep underground and have to keep their wits about them to get to the coveted treasure. The characters are extremely comical, and there is an element of romance between Andy (a cute cheerleader) and Brand (Mikey's older and hunky brother). I will never get tired of the movie, simply because it is silly and it fun to watch. The story is so out there that you can't help but like it. It makes you want to be a part of the adventure and makes you feel like a kid again.

reviews.review_title: You should watch this for yourself.
reviews.content: This movie was as good as it was. I rated this based on zero being the Paris Hilton video and 10 being The Goonies. ON this scale, this was most definitely a 10. I don't know what 5 would be on this scale. Some movie that is not the Paris Hilton porn or The Goonies, but is something else altogether such as Stephen King's IT. This movie could therefore not be a 5, as it is not Stephen King's IT. Much as it is not the Paris Hilton video. However this movie is The Goonies, so it is therefore rated a 10, as a ten is The Goonies. This movie had actors in it. On a scale of 1 to 10 for the actors, 1 being a completely different movie, and 10 being this movie, this movie is rated a 10 for the actors. I hope you found this helpful.

This is one of the best movies made! It is enjoyable for everyone, children and adults as well.  The acting is great, and the plot is great too.  It's a movie you will love, and so will your parents. You will never get tired of it.  I have nothing bad to say about this movie. I really hope they make a second one.  Sean Astin(Mikey) and Corey Feldman(Mouth) are too cute! =D

if this is not the greatest film ever made, i dont know what i will do to myself.  You can keep all your citizen kanes because when i watch a movie i am looking for 100% entertainment.  And luckily enough this film provides 101% entertainment. I could talk about how much i love this film all day and how brilliant all the characters are.  But the single greatest part of the film is the relationship between sloth and chunk.  They both would be amazingly funny by themselves but pair them together and you have the single greatest comic duo on the face of the planet. How can you not laugh when they are declaring their love to each other or the lines which sloth comes out with, "hey you guys" for instance.  But my favourite line is where chunk screams, "its a stiff".  It still has me in stitches at the 100th viewing.

I loved this movie as a kid, and guess what? I still love it today.Funny, cute charming, warm, exciting... what more can you want.I still keep hearing about the sequel which I don't want to see, because it could ruin this masterpiece. This movie has to be one of the greatest movies ever made.Magic!

reviews.review_title: In defense of the greatest movie ever . . .
reviews.content: Everybody is saying that this movie is full of stereotypes. And it is - the Chinese kid is an inventor and doesn't speak English, etc. But that's the point - that the movie's full of stereotypes. It's supposed to be like that. It's supposed to be a classic adventure movie, and sorry to say, but those are "accepted" stereotypes and classic ingredients of adventure movies. The point is that the movie doesn't take itself seriously - it's a lighthearted film. And that means that Y'ALL shouldn't take the movie (and yourselves) so seriously. Don't be offended. Just watch the movie and have fun. DUH.

I am not an 80's child, but I saw this movie in the mid 90's when I was younger, and I was immediately sucked up in the awesome adventure and thrill of it all (of course I saw the edited TV version, and I missed some of the meanings of the jokes, etc.). I forgot about it until a few weeks ago, when my friend who had just bought it started raving about it. So I went out and bought the DVD, remembering my love for the movie as a kid, and it was WORTH it, totally. This movie is THE ultimate kid's adventure! It has romance, action, and lots of humor. It was AWESOME. All the kids are wonderful, and the villains were great, too! The DVD has great special features, considering that it's an 80's movie. And the soundtrack is so catchy! ("Good enough for you . . .") Spielberg did a GREAT job! 10 outta 10!!!!!!!!!
The Goonies is a movie that has only one way to describe it AMAZING! Love everything about it.

reviews.review_title: Nostalgic escape from grown up worries.
reviews.content: Whenever I find myself becoming over-stressed from my college workload; I take a break and pop in the Goonies. I work part time in a video store, and with all of the movies I can choose freely from, I still consistently watch this movie over any other. It probably symbolizes the 80's from a kid's point of view better than any other single film, and it brings me back to that time in my life when I didn't have to worry about exams, rent, and career choices. While I might not have searched for buried treasure, we all have those moments from childhood that we would like to live again. The Goonies is my piece of mind packaged in an endearing tale of friendship, adventure, and that timeless experience of childhood.
Joke of a man... get back to rating starsigns! 20 out of a hundred! I'm guessing Lucas nailed your wife

the goonies is an outstanding piece of invention right from the begging with the truffle shuffle i was creased up the way they all set out to look for willies long lost treasure to save their homes and town is just amazing. however everyone knows to make a good film you have bad guys in it and of course these bad guys are so annoying with wanting the treasure for themselves but as usual the goonies are all there to save the day and prove them wrong by trying their hardest to get to the treasure before the bad guys do and its amazing with data's inventions from slick shoes to his teeth that grab onto things when falling, and the famous line i will always remember is "data hates falling, data has had enough of falling." it is my favorite line ever and the way it ends is just amazing with the ship going off in the background setting sail for its next adventure.

Some parts in this movie are priceless, and make it an enjoyable film to watch. The main four kids (Mikey, Mouth, Data, and Chunk) all contributed something to the film, but the only thing about this movie that doesn't make sense is what are the other three there for? reviews.review_title: A must-see for kids of all ages...
reviews.content: I was ten years old when I watched The Goonies for the first time. Mom took me to the cinema, and I bet she wasn't aware of what that film would mean to me. Now it's a bunch of years after, and it remains untouchable on my list of favorite movies. I think it's so charming, I mean, the whole mixture of pirates, adventure, humour, friendship, treasure-hunting, bad-but-dumb-criminals...even hints of teenage love! It's got everything you need to have a wonderful time in front of the T.V., just couch-potatoing with a big bowl of popcorn...I'd just say The Goonies is a must-see for kids of all ages, specially the ones in their mid-late twenties now, as that means they were same age as The Goonies when the movie plot took place.

There is only one thing that could make this movie better and that is if it was uncut and on DVD.  If you want to relive your memories when you were a child, I suggest watching this one and Stand By Me.

I grew up with all the Steven Spielberg movies from the 80's, and The Goonies is one of them (Spielberg wrote the story). This movie is a great adventure, perfect for both the young ones and the old ones. The characters are very interesting and some are really funny. They have their own life and their own story to tell. And together they make this movie to something special. I can only remember one other movie that I can compare to this one; Stand By Me (Corey Feldman has a role in this movie and in The Goonies). Almost the same characters and a bit of an adventure (even though it is more quite and slow in a sense). See The Goonies and become a part of a real Spielberg Adventure!

reviews.review_title: What more could you need than an 80's comedy.action flick starring Corey Feldman and Sean Astin?

The acting is very great, I mean give 'em credit, they are very young.  The music is very good as well.  If you are looking for a movie that brings back the 80's Goonies is a definite winner.  I mean, it even has the song "Girls Just Wanna Have Fun"!! Enjoy!!! ~M

The Goonies is my all-time favorite movie. I've seen it hundreds of times and I never get tired of it. Being only 14, I found that most people my age, have never even heard of this film, forget seen it, I however adore it, and it has been my favourite film for three years. I only saw this because my mother had recorded it off channel five and not being a film fan, had promptly not watched it, leaving it to me to tell her about it. I watched it and instantly fell in love with it. Even though at times it's corny and unrealistic, the enthusiasm in the little people and the amazing story makes up for it completely. One friend I showed it to, disliked it, however I am under the impression she is a crazed lunatic, who has had the disadvantage of pretending to be mature and therefore missed out on the wonder that is 'The Goonies'! You can quickly connect with the characters and their need for excitement and adventure. One can laugh at their jokes, and generally all the crazy things they say; scream at the bad people and the giant squid and join in their amazing adventure. This film shows you seven children's last desperate attempt to remain in the home they love, with the friends they have been forced to make after the rest of the world rejected them. Like 'stand by me' it is a story of growth and heroism and how friendship is precious enough to die for.

This is the definitive children/teenage movie that I think everyone should see at least once.The movie is very funny and element of adventure in the movie is also superb.All in all this is a movie that I think can be viewed over and over again without losing anything from the first experience.

reviews.review_title: The Gold Standard for 80's kids films
reviews.content: The Goonies is an absolutely classic children's film that will be a favourite for years to come. A superbly paced and well acted film, it keeps you energised and totally focused on the ensuing action.When I first saw the film, aged about 10, I was totally entranced from the dangerous treasure hunting stunts to the hilarious comedic elements involving Data and, of course, The Fratellis.I still watch this today on DVD (which by the way has a great reunion of the original cast on it - Chunk looks very different these days!) and it stands up as a film that can be watched and enjoyed by adults. It has a dreamlike innocence, without being mawkish, that is sadly lacking in many of today's films for children. Even better is the fact that this is achieved with a cast of kids who are not perfect, but reflect how kids really are. There are badly behaved, spoilt, obese, intelligent, sensitive, sports mad, vain, asthma-ridden and geeky characters on show but by the end you feel something for them all.An amazing film and a cultural reference point for growing up in the 80's.

The "Goonies" is one of the classical 80s flicks, but is still unique. It is funny and entertaining; it's witty and mysterious. I just loved the "Goonies" it is one of my favorite 80s movies. Josh Brolin and Sean Austin were terriffic together. Kerri Green and Corey Feldman also did a great performance.

reviews.review_title: "Its good enough for you, its good enough for me..."
reviews.content: I have never been so scared in all my life, as a young ankle biter witnessing this ugly, mutant like monster ripping at the chains which held him, in the depths of the dusty and murky shop. As the film progressed I was becoming increasingly braver as the beast that was Sloth, was bonding with the creator of the truffle shuffle. I started to witness human emotions seeping through the rugged exterior of him. Yes, you might say he began to grow on me especially as I saw he was a fan of Superman also. Despite the gentle side of this character would you really invite him to live with you?Why, oh why has this not got a rating of 10 - A true childrens great (despite the consistent mistakes)

reviews.review_title: Gruesome in some parts, offensive in others, but for a kid I guess it's kinda ok
reviews.content: Watched this movie as part of a course about writing for children.First, the film is for kids and it's noticeable. The solutions proposed to the conflicts in the story and also some of the situations do not seem realistic. There is a lot of humor on the verge of being gruesome or raw or a bit offensive. For example the scenes with the corpse that fell on the fat kid Chunk or when he finds himself in the trunk with the corpse. The children themselves are cartoons. One is the inventor, INSPECTOR GADGET style, the other is the cool guy with the slick talk (and also knows 17th century Spanish), the third is the fat guy who is fixated on food and the fourth is the "normal" kid. A lot of the jokes are related to "Chunk" (the kid) being fat and all the prejudices regarding overweight people (e.g. They are obsessed with food).If they were making the movie today, a lot of things would be taken out, especially some of the jokes about overweight people ('Chunk' has to take off his shirt and squirm and shake his belly and only then the kids open the gate for him). Occasionally, from time to time the movie has a good joke. But a lot of the scenes are played for laughs with not a lot of additional added value except from kids entertainment.In conclusion - a film intended for children with some terrifying and frightening scenes (for example Mrs. Fratelli threatens to cut Chunk's tongue, threatens to put his hand in a food mixer, a dead federal agent body falls twice on Chunk). I personally found these scenes very unpleasant to watch. I do understand how very young children can enjoy this movie somehow. But unlike another children's movie called "E. T." it doesn't really hold water for the adult viewer. It's a pretty good movie but definitely not a classic (at least in my eyes). In the MeToo and PC era of today - a lot would have been edited out and rightfully so.

The Goonies has been my all time favorite movie ever since I was a kid. (around the time it was released). I have seen this movie hundreds and hundreds of times, and not once have I ever gotten tired of it. Whats NOT to love about The Goonies!?!?! This movie inspired me to be a little adventurous as a kid, always hoping that something amazing would happen! Haha! This is a movie that will last for generations! Goonies #1 in my book!!

reviews.review_title: I'm a Goonie and I never say die!
reviews.content: I remember when I was growing up that I wanted be just like Captain Hook or Captain Jack Sparrow and have all the gold and treasure in the world. I wanted to go on treasure hunts with Peter Pan and call it all mineI made everything in my life an adventure. There were always new "caves" to discover and land that just had to have treasure in it somewhere. I was bound and determined to find it. The first time I watched The Goonies, I wanted to be as brave and determined as Mikey. I wanted to be a Goonie.When this movie caught my eye, I knew that we would have to have it. Adventure was my forte and I wasn't going to let this adventure slip through my fingers. It made me want to go find Mikey and say, "Hey lets go get that treasure together!" The movie is set in 1985 in Astoria, Oregon. Seven kids only have a few days left before their homes get bought and turned into a golf course. They are desperate to find anything that can help save their house. While digging around in the attic, Mikey finds a treasure map that leads to the legendary treasure of "One-Eyed" Willy. There adventure begins at an abandoned summer restaurant. It is owned by the wanted Fratelli thieves. Little do they know that trouble is coming their way when they hide in the fire place in the basement of the restaurant. This is a funny, action packed movie with twists and turns that will make you want more. Watch it and live the greatest adventure of your life.

This is a classic comedy movie from the 80s...i was born a few years after this movie even came out and i watch it is one of my favorites, this movie also appeals to adults too, as my parents and a few of my teachers claim this is one of their favorites... funny...but not stupid funny

Even though to fully appreciate this film you need to have been a child or early teen in the 1980's, this movie still provides excellent entertainment value for today's youth. This movie is pretty much an ode to childhood exuberance, dealing with such fantastical issues such as pirate ships, hidden treasure, bad guys, booby traps (or booty traps whatever's your poison) and the art of having fun.The Goonies themselves are fairly likeable, though they do have a tendency to talk over each other; but I guess that's what kids do. Joey Pants and band of bad guys make for excellent villains, and give our heroes a good run for their money.All in all, get your purple rain t-shirt and head band start bopping away to cyndi lauper and her terrible theme song!

When I was 6 years old, my parents took me to the movies to see The Goonies. I was immediately a fan at the age of six. The intrepid gang of friends, attempting one last try at having an adventure before they all have to move away from each other, the thrill of solving century-old puzzles, the suspense from the bad guys, the pirate-themed ending,...it had it all for a 6 year old. To this day, I don't think any other movie has captured my attention as much as this Richard Donner gem. I tip my hat off to you, Mr. Donner. You have a fan for life.

I saw this movie in the theater during its original release and it has continued to be one of my favorite movies of all time. Whenever this film appears on television I find myself helpless to turn the channel or shutoff the TV. I later found out that my father was good friends with Curtis Hanson, who played Elgin Perkens (Troys Father). He gave me a few little in-depth stories about the parts of the movie he was involved in and I found it quite interesting. I have seen this movie countless times and I was very pleased when the DVD was released and there were previously deleted scenes added. I love having a film that you have loved for years and years and then a special release comes out with scenes that you had never scene before. Anyone who has not seen this movie should put it on the priority list.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the greatest film in the World
reviews.content: I love this movie. Every time it's on tv. I watch it. I have the video. I have the dvd. I know what the octopus looks like and I know it would have filled my pants if I'd seen it the first time I saw the movie.The Goonies will stand the test of time. I know this to be true. When I worked at a cinema I forced a cult film season to be shown and it was my one aim to get this on regardless. And it was on. And it sold out. In fact, it sold out and had to be moved to a larger screen to accomodate more people - and then it sold out again.Why? This film is timeless. Yes, the music holds it back and yes, it is a bit jumpy (the cinema print anyway) but there is nothing like this film and there will be nothig like this film. The only thing that comes remotely close is Indiana Jones. It is was and always will be original. No-one will ever top it.The Goonies. You know you love it.

reviews.review_title: The Goonies is a non-stop adventure for the whole family!
reviews.content: Welcome to Astoria, Oregon. At first glance, this small seaside community seems to be just another safe yet uneventful stop amongst small-town USA. However, between rogue bankers and escaped convicts, there is more trouble than meets the eye in Astoria! Enter the Goonies. Brothers Mikey and Brand Walsh team up with pals to make the self-named band of misfits, whom always seem to find themselves right in the thick of things. This time a group of development bankers are foreclosing on all the property around the Goonies' neighborhoods to make room for a new golf course. Now the Goonies must embark on a dangerous journey to find the infamous pirate One-Eyed Willy's hidden treasure, in hopes to pay-off the bank and save their families' homes. The Goonies treasure hunt is filled with twists and turns and not to mention a few booby traps! To top it all off the Goonies are being chased by the Fratellis, a criminal family fresh off a jail-break! Can they beat all the odds and save the day? Join Mikey and the gang as they take you on one treasure hunt that you cannot afford to miss!

reviews.review_title: Looking for a safe movie to just succumb to? Try this safe harbor in the pacific northwest. Great "Goonie" Relaxation.......
reviews.content: I can remember seeing this several times in the theater with my friend Geoff Chisholm. Years later I would have the chance to see the house where the the "Walsh family home" was located (on a tour of Astoria, Oregon).Astoria, a safe harbor town in the peaceful pacific northwest is a rarity in this day and age. The film seemed to bring the town to life. Not featured in the film is a quaint street car line. It is quite a lovely place to spend a weekend and certainly the continued success of the film has contributed to its survival.One of the most interesting spots to visit in Astoria is the classic JC Penney store. The store on the outside resembles something from the 1930's. Inside you'll find much of the same contemporary merchandise you'd find at any JC Penney store in any mall. But Astoria, seems to have a magical ability to preserve its history and stay current at the same time.Same is true for this film. It doesn't SEEM like a 27 year old movie.But it is.Actually it isn't. The movie is the same. We are just all 27 years older.Watching it today through the prism of a man with 27 years of life experience doesn't make it any less exciting.The car chase on the beach.The creative gadgetry of "Data" sliding down the home made zip line. "Data" had a zip line BEFORE any one knew what a zip line was.Chunk knocking over the statue and "breaking Brandon's mother's favorite part".A very private part by the way.Jeff Burleson and Geoff Chisholm (we took the whole staff to a screening in Sisters, OR on Maple Lane at Loker Avenue) heartily recommend this film for anyone who loves teenage adventure, wholesome goodness and the hard work of Steven Spielberg BEFORE he became STEVEN Spielberg.

The Goonies is just an absolute classic. I can watch this over and over and not get bored of it. Sean Astin (Mikey) is just perfect in his role. Jeff Cohen (Chunk) makes me laugh all the time. Corey Feldman (Clark) is also hilarious in a cool style. Jonathan Quan is just great in his supporting role with all of his inventions. All the obstacles that these boys face trying to get a treasure is just hilarious. They are trying to save their homes from being destroyed. They find a map in their attic that may be able to lead them to "One Eyed Willys" treasure. They run into many obstacles and each one is funnier and funnier. For anyone who hasn't seen this movie. Go get it.

Born in 1987, I was unfortunate enough not be alive at the release of The Goonies. However, as a child growing up it was a film I would see on the TV (usually around Christmas, when a lot of films were previewing) - and for some reason it would always be my luck to only grab the last hour or thirty minutes of the film.However, nearing the age of 7 years old, my dad set the timer for when it was on - he knew how much I wanted to see the whole episode! I watched it, at at 7 for a film, 9 years old. It became my favourite film ever.For me it just sums up childhood 'one big adventure' - now a fixture in my DVD collection, I could watch it every night of every week and never get boured. A film never to be forgotten!

The Goonies is an must-watch film. It has become an iconic film. It is a masterpiece in the sense that most of the adventure movies for kids follow it in one or another way. It has elements that make it unique. For instance, the weird Slot. There is no real reason for him, but still, there it is, and it makes the movie a classic. There is a few things that can be better, like kids not knowing where to go or what to do instead of them solving all the problems immediately. This movie deserved a second part, but unfortunately actors are now too old and a new remake cannot be better than original.

The Goonies is about a group of young adults that guide themselves into an adventure on the quest to find a legendary lost treasure. The film illustrates the importance of working as a team to beat impossible circumstances. Sean Astin plays the main character Mikey, who is first to discover an old treasure map in family home's attic. His brother Brand is played by a young, Josh Brolin. These two play opposites character wise. Brand is more athletic and strong while Mikey is smaller and has an external weakness of asthma. However it is Mikey that is the one who guides the group of misfits through an underground, booby trap adventure and discover the treasure. The brother's family home is about to be foreclosed on unless their parents can come up with the money.Other stars of the film include Goonies: Kerri Green, who plays Andy, a cheerleader and love interest to Brolin's character, Kerri Green, who plays Stef, Corey Feldman as Mouth, Jeff Cohen as Chunk, and Ke-Huy Quan as Data. The group is constantly on the run from the Fratelli crime family, who in the opening scenes helps one of their counterparts escape jail. Anne Ramsey plays Mama Fratelli, who discovers what the "goony" group is up to and prompts her sons Jake and Francis, who are played by Robert Davi and Joe Pantoliano, respectively, to chase after them. There is one more son, Sloth, played by John Matoszak, who is deformed and has a growling Frankenstein-like dialog. Sloth is left behind along with a captured Chunk who soon becomes friends over the love for food and they join forces to go save the "goonies" from the Fratellis who are on their trail. Each goony character played an important role in helping the group advance further in discovering the treasure. Those that stood out were: Mikey (Astin) who is the encourager that will not give up in helping his family and will not allow the group to give up either, Data (Quan), is equipped with special gadgets that help the goonies get through the trail to the treasure and Mouth (Feldman), is able to interpret the map which is in Spanish and helps to give the film a funnier edge with his smart antics. The character Sloth (Matoszak) ends up becoming an honorary goony for his attempts to rescue them from his family. The Goonies was an earlier kiddy version of the Disney film, National Treasure (2004), which stars Nicholas Cage as a treasure hunter who is looking for mysterious and unbeknown artifacts. Unlike The Goonies his adventures are around the entire country not just below one Oceanside suburb. Perhaps both films draw from the film, Indiana Jones (1981-1989, 2008), which stars Harrison Ford as a part time college professor and part time adventurous historian, who travels the globe to rescue artifacts from the wrong hands and put them in a museum. All these films focus on defeating the odds and a hero shining through at the end. However, I believe Goonies was the first to focus on a group of children on this type of quest. The film uses techniques in camera angles and lighting to give a more realistic feel to the viewer. There are points were you actually forget the adventure is really only taking place underneath a town. Throughout most of the film, low key lighting is used to draw the audience into the setting of the dark cave the group is in. It gives an eerie feeling while at the same time allowing for the element of surprise of what may be up next. It was also very natural like you are right there with the characters, especially when they use candles and flashlights as the main light source. A diagonal camera angle was used in some scenes to present an approaching feel. Especially when the group was traveling into the unknown as one. The characters are in a grouping of shortest to tallest from front to back to give this angle an even greater effect. These techniques were needed to bring the audience into the actions on the screen and engage their interest further.All the elements tie in to make this film enjoyable to watch and be a part of. Each character was able to hold your interest with their unique talent and ways. Each scene of their adventure will allow you to seem as if you are part of the effort to find the treasure. This film gives great significance to the word teamwork and will encourage those biggest to smallest to stop at nothing to make a dream reality.

reviews.review_title: Needs to be seen the right way...
reviews.content: The Goonies might never be hailed as the best movie ever, but for a lot of people who grew up in/were born in the 80s, its one of the most important films of that decade... ...Most of the negative comments here are from people taking the film out of context - its not meant for everyone, and its definitely not supposed to be taken as a serious cinematic achievement... Its also not made for people who intend to make harsh judgements about the acting or the political correctness of the characters - its made for people who either arent looking for or couldnt recognise those things... It's easy to just dismiss a film like this as badly made just because you didnt get it, but if you try and watch it as its meant to be seen, it could reward you...The Goonies was one of the first films i rented more than 10 times as a kid... Theres something about the exaggerated stereotype characters that helps the film still have an emotional effect on me 15 years later - Mouth's 'this was my dream...' speech still makes me wanna go out in the street and shout goonies never say die... The film kind of grew up with me, too - when i first saw it at 5 years old, a lot of the jokes were lost on me, and re-watching it over time has let me get more from it each time...If you're gonna watch this film for the first time, dont go into it expecting some kind of classic work of cinematic art or even something that rivals Indiana Jones as an adventure film - The Goonies was specifically for the young (or people who dont want to grow up), and if you're over 14 and watching it for the first time, you'll probably have to try and see it from a kids perspective - its worth it to, just for an hour and a half, forget you've grown up and appreciate the fact that it's a kids fantasy adventure film...Oh, and if you saw it as a kid and havent seen it since, its definitely worth watching again - especially if you can get the chance to see it in public with other people who grew up with it...

reviews.review_title: One of the best adventure movies of the 80's
reviews.content: They just don't make movies like this anymore.  I never get tired of 'The Goonies', as it reminds me of my childhood.  It's every boy's fantasy come true!  Buried treasure, pirate ships, booby traps, and BMX bikes!  It's the quintessential youth adventure movie.  If you haven't seen it yet, you may not think it's all that great, but if you saw it as a kid, the magic is still there.

Even today as a film student I still enjoy it and somehow find the time to watch it at least twice a year. The story is good. The acting is okay, though the characters are quite memorable. Who can forget Data, Sloth, Chunk, Mouth, etc.? I know I can't. The music, especially the theme by Cyndi Lauper, is firmly set in the mid-80's which really adds to the nostolgic effect (I still have the 45!). The score is also good and I think it actually adds something to the feeling of the film. I would definately recommend this to anyone who was a kid in the early/mid 1980's. When I watch it I always feel like I've been taken back years to a whole different time and world. It really is a modern classic!

reviews.review_title: They have yet to make a kid's adventure like it.

With The 'Goonies', Every Day is June 7th!This rowdy child's adventure flick is a must see no matter how old you are. It is a true 1980's classic written by Steven Spielberg and Chris Colombus. The movie takes place on the Pacific northwestern coastal town where a group of the "weird" kids at school convince each other to search for the hidden treasure on One-Eyed Willy's ship. Each iconic character has a unique attitude that brings such life to the movie. Whether it be between the junk food driven teen named Chunk, or the next Inspector Gadget named Huy-Quan, when they're all together, they'll make for an adventure film that will keep your attention the entire hour and 54 minutes.The Goonies also incorporates a heartwarming relationship story between a popular teenager and his lame younger brother that will leave you with a smile on your face. For a movie that was popular when my parents were kids, being made over 30 years ago, is still considered a classic to my generation today. June 7th was announced to be "Goonies Day" by the mayor of Astoria, Oregon where the film was shot in 1985. This legendary motion picture is a timeless film that will carry on for generations to come.

reviews.review_title: Don't just superficially watch The Goonies.
reviews.content: In 1985 Steven Spielberg directed a movie titled The Goonies. There is much more to this movie than what simply meets the eye. The Goonies, follows a group of young hooligan boys around their hometown of Astoria, Oregon as they search for a mysterious buried treasure. The Goonies, one of Spielberg's funnier films focuses on younger people, because of this, many movie critics are harsh in their reviews towards. These reviews will sadden those who truly love the movie The Goonies. If watched superficially, what appears in is a bunch of annoying kids running around their hometown without parental supervision as they search for hidden treasure, as well as bad acting and not great filming. But The Goonies teaches lessons that are simple, beautiful, and even for some life changing.  Although the movie is focused on the younger generation all, old and young alike can enjoy and learn from these lessons. Critics have stated, "The storyline was weak." Another said, "The story is annoying." These critics have only ever watched this movie with a superficial lens, sadly they have failed to see what the movie is all about. Spielberg directed this summer popcorn film in such a way that it can be learned from. These lessons come to us as the Goonies express attributes through their actions as they adapt to the life crisis on hand. One of these examples happens when the young Goonies follow a map to an old summer home, and despite a scary looking family occupying the house they press on to see if they can find the next step on the map. Through this experience the young Goonies teach us the lesson of determination and courage, the attributes are vital in order for us to get through our own life crises. As the Goonies press on they face many traps created to kill them or make them so scared that they would turn around but, these young boys and girls have something driving them. A drive is something that will always help us to get through our lives crises, it will push us not to quit and to do whatever is necessary to reach our goals. Finally, the Goonies show an incredible amount of maturity for their age, with maturity they were able to see and understand what really was important. Having a clear understanding about what was really important to the Goonies, they were able to know what they must do in order for them to get through their crisis.          These are only three examples of how the Goonies personality traits throughout the movie can teach us to better prepare ourselves for when crises come into our lives. These of course are not the only lessons to be learned form The Goonies, but it is a good start. The Goonies is much more then just a silly kids action/adventure movie, its for all generations to learn and grow from. Steven Spielberg produced this movie knowing that he could hide some awesome lessons from the beginning of the movie to the ending credits. As you watch this movie don't just watch it it superficially but to watch it in a deeper way, for in this way will you learn from its lessons, you will soon bee defending this 1980 classic much more.

reviews.review_title: Compliments Spielberg and his work with the fantastic adventure The Goonies
reviews.content: The Goonies is one of the many reasons Spielberg is the greatest man in Hollywood. The movie is a adventure that is so brilliant. The characters and the story go together so simply and each one is an asset to the film. Spielberg was crowned along time before this film as the King of Hollywood. This is just another one of his treasures of all the great things in his Kingdom.

reviews.review_title: Writer of the story seemed determined to make the kids fail
reviews.content:
A classic. Very energetic and pretty innocent for kids, as most reviewers say.But also as at least one other says, nothing is spoken - it is all screamed.(Reminds me of un-talented directors zooming into an eyeball ... so you will ... "identify" with the character ?? ... or something - to which, in watching a movie, and the situation comes along, I say "here comes the eyeball again").In this case, it seems that if you want to emphasize a statement, you scream it. Except almost none of the lines was more significant than any other. Plus they were all screaming at once.Apart from that topic:
I have a problem with the original writing. I felt, for the characters in the plot, plus for myself, a viewer, pretty insulted by the mountainous improbabilies and its dropping of its own story path. Preparing all along, it seems to make sure that they failed. The boobie traps were not so much of a problem as the writing traps.If they were after the treasure, and found it, why did they give up so easily when the old woman grabbed their hands and told them to give what they had to her? And even more so once she was arrested?? In the real world, she would have been so overwhelmed, as they were, that she wouldn't care a bit if they got a few million while she also did.While she was crooked, surely she was not "evil". Why the spite?And to top it off, after they surfaced, at the end, and she and sons were arrested, the treasure was still there, so the story insults us (as well as those kids), by just totally ignoring the fact that they could now, undisturbed, go back in and get it ( !! ). Then when the ship sailed away ... it was on the ship. So just get in a boat and go get it there.Not to mention that it took the Goonies a long dangerous path to get to the treasure, then all of a sudden, there she was. ( Duh! ). Did she know a shortcut??I'd rather it had been written more intelligently. Go for the gold, get the gold, and live happily ever after. So the message for kids here is: "Don't aspire to anything great, because it is impossible to attain". Triple-Duh.

reviews.review_title: For the child in all of us
reviews.content: "The Goonies" was the the film my brother, sister and I watched everyday of the holidays as children, we played on our bikes, made up maps, made camps, tried to invent cool contraptions and always went looking for treasure. This film captures the essence of childhood, when you believed in miracles, had no fear and thought you could do anything. The film although made twenty years ago hasn't aged in a bad way at all, however it does manage to show just how bad the so called kids adventure films of today really are. "The Goonies" requires kids to use their imagination and to pretend. No matter how many times you see this film it doesn't get old, I still want to be a "Goonie", it's for the child in all of us and I always feel nostalgic seeing it again. If you are going to watch this movie, do yourself a favour get it on DVD. Do not watch it on television the film is always cut to shreds and parts of it do not make sense, besides it's one you should really own. If only they still made films of this quality with this much magic.

"The Goonies" is definitly one of my all time favorite movies! It reminds me of adventures I always use to fantasize about as a kid. The plot is about a group of outcast friends (they call themselves the Goonies) who find a treasure map of a long lost treasure. The kids, who are about to lose their houses decide to try and help their parents by embarking on the adventure of a lifetime. On their search for 'the rich stuff' they uncover the hideout of the Fratelli's, a family of bumbling bad guys. The child actors are amazing. My personal favorite is Mikey, (played by an adorable Sean Astin) the leader of the group. You may also see some other familar faces, like Corey Feldman-the wise cracking 'Mouth', Josh Brolin-macho big brother 'Brand', and Martha Plimpton-Andi's friend 'Stef'. This movie is a great childhood classic. I highly recommend it even if you are just a kid at heart. It has great 80's styles and feeling. It is a movie you can never get tired of, (believe me, I've seen this movie atleast 30 times!!!! And it is still one of my favorites.) If you haven't seen this movie yet go out and rent it! And if you have a DVD player, check out the DVD. It has a full length commentary by 'The Goonies' all grown up!I give this movie a 10/10!!!!!

All the characters act absolutely filthy and braindead (which is sad because these actors went on to do much better things in their lives). In fact, the actual age is so confusing that when I look up Corey Feldman on this site, his bio lies to me about the films he starred in (the site claims that "Gremlins" and this film are "kid-friendly" even though when you watch them, you'll realize that they're actually not). Anyway, back to this. The story is cliche. The Goonies themselves are so annoying and are just constantly fighting over each other. They yell, swear, fight, and start literally doing not kid-friendly stuff (such as looking up people's skirts and making jokes about a statue's penis). The most annoying character of all, Chunk, gets kidnapped by the villains and literally just cries and whines his ass off for like five minutes in front of them. Literally right in front of them. Then he feeds the deformed guy I can't even remember the name of Baby Ruth (wow.) Then the other brats find the ship, Chunk reunites with the kids, then the ship just sails off and eventually sinks. I just don't really care anymore. I know all of you guys like this film, but throughout the movie, I was hoping for all the kids to fall to their deaths or something like that. All I will say is, if you want a good Spielberg film, just watch Jaws, Close Encounters, E.T., Indiana Jones, Jurassic Park, Back to the Future, and all other stuff. This did not deserve my time at all. Even Gremlins is better compared to this. And the fact that my mom likes this film makes this whole thing worse. Just avoid this. Anyone who says this is good is an idiot.

The Goonies, what a fun movie. I will admit Richard Donner's direction was a little too leisurely and there are some parts in the middle half that are too slow and falls dangerously into cloying sentimentality. Still this childhood favourite of mine is great fun from beginning to end. No matter how thin the story is, it has an intriguing premise and Donner and Chris Columbus keep the action going strong and the adventure fun enough for the younger audience. The script is funny and affectionate, the music is memorable and in general the special effects are good. The image of the pirate ship was mind blowing and the cinematography and costumes are very well done. The performances are very good; while Sean Astin and Corey Feldman are the standouts of the child cast, it is Anne Ramsey who steals the show as Ma Fetali in a effortlessly over the top and deliciously evil performance, very like Diana Dors in The Amazing Mr Blunden. All in all, a fun adventure yarn. 8/10 Bethany Cox

The story is about a gang of criminals on the run while an innocent group of kids get caught up in an adventure. Four of them are a group of boys determined to save their house from being demolished. Another one is the older brother to the boy Mikey (who gets the idea of saving the house) and two girls, one called Andi who is in love with the older brother Brand and another girl tagging along with Andi. Eventually all the kids are caught in a wildcat adventure of getting money to save their house by finding some treasure while along the way they come across the bandits who want the treasure too. 

The film is similar to an Indiana Jones film. It even has the same kid actor from Temple Of Doom. However it's more kid friendly but has the same structure of an Indiana Jones story. Lots of comedy and adventure and thrills. Most of the comedy stems from the fish out of water aspects of where the characters are. As stated, these kids have reasons why they have gone on this adventure. Mikey is the one who gets the idea of saving the house, while his friends, Mouth (the blabbermouth) Chunk (the big eater) and Data (the tech whiz) come along as their homes are in danger of being demolished too. As you can tell by the names, Mikey's friends are pretty eccentric yet have potential talents. Mouth, despite barely shutting up, uses his mouth to his advantage with his gift for Spanish. Chunk may be obsessed with food but he ends up saving his friends after coming in contact with one of the less mean criminals. And Data's inventions prove to be pretty useful along the adventure as silly as they can be.
 Holding this group together is Mikey. The most normal of the group and the guide for the audience. He's pretty much the most relatable low key member of  the group. He's fearless and the most determined out of all his friends despite being the least eccentric.
 Then there's Mikey's brother Brand. He doesn't mind too much about moving and comes along reluctantly as he's trying to protect his brother. It's only when Andi comes along that Brand decides to come along. In turn, Andi comes along because as long as she's with Brand, Andi doesn't mind going on the adventure. While she does overcome her naivety along the journey, learning about the dangers she has put herself in, its not all for the bad. Andi uses her piano skills to help during a perilous part of the adventure. Like Andi, Steff doesn't have any idea of the perils of the journey either but comes along as she shares close ties with Andi. However, unlike Andi, Steff is more cynical and sarcastic and not as naïve as Andi

The romance subplots felt a little tacked on too, but otherwise the villains were excellent and the child actors acquitted themselves well. The production design was solid, though I have an issue where I noticed that 1982's Poltergeist and 1993's Jurassic Park had practically the exact same prop tree in it and realized that Spielberg has an ultra-distinct style of prop/background design that has made other movies he's involved in look less realistic to me. The score really follows the action well and crescendos at all the appropriate moments. I'll surely rewatch this again in a few years.
